column1: This Thanksgiving may look different this year due to social distancing.   Be safe.   Be smart.   Listen to the advice of public health experts when planning your celebration.
Happy #VeteransDay to all who served.     Thank you to every servicemember who has sworn to defend our country and the values it stands for.
Happy 245th Birthday to @USMC! Thank you to all of the brave men and women who have made it their mission to protect and preserve the freedoms of this great nation.

I'm sad to hear that Sheriff Scott Worsley has transitioned from labor to reward. May he be remembered for his dedication to serving & protecting the people of Miller Co. My thoughts & prayers are w/ his family & the people of Miller Co. as we mourn this great public servant.

@Instacart using SNAP at @AldiUSA increases food security when more than 54M are experiencing food insecurity. I’m pleased Georgians in Columbus & Macon will be first in line to try this out & I hope Americans everywhere will have this option soon. https://t.co/Ct6U3iH2sK

Outdoor Network is hiring! For Albany to gain 100 new jobs during the COVID-19 pandemic is wonderful. I will continue supporting efforts to create new jobs and prosperity for Albany and the rest of our district. https://t.co/LZYR5zO8dN

I am pleased the Court has stopped the Administration from taking food off the tables of American families. To take away SNAP benefits would be to kick food insecure Americans while they are down and harm our economic recovery.  https://t.co/zee4pVIs2v

One of the most important things to me as the Ag Approps Chairman is making sure the crops we grow in GA continue their massive contributions to our economies. Pecans & peanuts are very healthy & are also two of our largest agricultural exports as a state. https://t.co/QVLfhdKecz https://t.co/TV3pEycS4w

I’m deeply saddened to hear that Sheriff Pete Smith passed away. He was a truly dedicated & passionate sheriff for Sumter County who will be missed. I’ll keep his family & the people of Sumter County in my prayers as they mourn this great man & public servant.
Make sure your community gets a fair and accurate count!   Complete your #2020Census before October 31 2020. 🗓   You can participate online by mail or by phone.   https://t.co/LSM0BFnAMM
Happy 245th Birthday to @USNavy!  Thank you to all of our nation's Sailors past and present for your service and for continuing the noble tradition of ”Victory at Sea.”
HAPPENING NOW: The virtual 2020 Military Family Caucus Summit w/ Rep. @cathymcmorris!    TUNE IN:  https://t.co/kOwMdU9laY

@FVSU has long been at the forefront of cutting-edge agricultural research & science. I know they will do great things with this grant from @USDA to improve children’s nutrition in the Baldwin County School District. https://t.co/gqKaQlqa2C

#2020Census data is vital to helping our communities thrive. It helps us obtain the healthcare transportation schools affordable housing & higher education that our families need to get a good start & succeed.  Complete yours at https://t.co/ztL61WjGr8 by 10/31.  #BeCounted

The virtual 2020 Military Family Caucus Summit w/ Rep. @cathymcmorris will take place on October 9th!  This year’s Summit will focus on COVID-19’s impact on our nation's military families & will feature keynote remarks from @EsperDoD    To register go to https://t.co/mGR1aMrxBb https://t.co/jTILzkUbat

The IRS has extended the Economic Impact Payment deadline to November 21 for Non-Filers who have not received a payment.   The Non-Filers tool can be found at https://t.co/hABPBxasjY  For additional info visit https://t.co/dUJp3WdlxR

I will keep the President First Lady and every American who has been infected with this terrible virus in my thoughts and prayers. This virus is not a hoax or joke. Wear a mask follow CDC guidelines and stay safe.

As the pandemic goes on it’s clear that we need a response to support our citizens & combat this virus. The updated Heroes Act reflects these priorities & I'm proud to support it. I urge the Senate & President to support this bill to help our nation. https://t.co/kDdpFv4was

I’m proud to join @RepMichaelGuest in leading this bipartisan letter encouraging Admin Wheeler of @USEPA to issue new registrations for four dicamba products that'll help farmers as they begin making decisions on their management strategies for next year. https://t.co/J8R6PFiQVD

The virtual 2020 Military Family Caucus Summit w/ Rep. @cathymcmorris will take place on October 9th!  This year’s Summit will focus on COVID-19’s impact on our nation's military families & will feature keynote remarks from @EsperDoD.  To register go to https://t.co/mGR1aMrxBb https://t.co/2rNilP3Fo4
The deadline to register to vote in Georgia is quickly approaching. Learn more about your voter registration your polling location and early voting by visiting https://t.co/HHHGH6spIA today.

Responding to the #2020Census is safe and confidential. Everyone should complete the #2020Census so our community gets the funding and representation it deserves. You can still complete your #2020Census at https://t.co/ztL61WjGr8.

I was saddened to the learn of the passing of Former Columbus Mayor Bob Poydasheff. He loved his family people country & Columbus GA. He’ll be missed but his legacy will live on through those who knew & loved him. https://t.co/8riRpmVXLk

The numbers don’t lie. Small business is vital to our economy in Georgia.   That’s why I’m working to ensure that small businesses have the resources needed to keep their doors open during these unprecedented times. https://t.co/TIaKbolpxE
This week is #HBCUWeek!   Georgia is the home of 10 nationally recognized Historically Black Colleges & Universities including @FVSU @AlbanyStateUniv and my alma mater @Morehouse.

The virtual 2020 Military Family Caucus Summit w/ Rep. @cathymcmorris  will take place on October 9th!  This year’s Summit will focus on COVID-19’s impact on our nation's military families & will feature keynote remarks from @EsperDoD  To register go to https://t.co/mGR1aMrxBb https://t.co/Jf8oncikHu

I'm pleased that we've reached an agreement to avoid a shutdown & raised the cap on the Commodity Credit Corporation (CCC) to protect farmers & ranchers. However I’m disappointed the Senate hasn't taken up the FY21 funding bills & Heroes Act.  https://t.co/WnoZMXKqev

Responding to the #2020Census is safe and confidential. Everyone should complete the #2020Census so our community gets the funding and representation it deserves. You can still complete your #2020Census at https://t.co/L9hpnB7Bdp
Are you registered to vote? Check your registration and learn more about voting in Georgia by visiting https://t.co/HHHGH6spIA today. This #NationalVoterRegistrationDay be sure you are #VoteReady.

The world has lost an icon hero and trailblazer. U.S. Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was a fierce champion for equality and civil rights who rose against the odds and dedicated her life to upholding the law. My sincerest condolences to her loved ones.
Happy new year to all those celebrating #RoshHashanah https://t.co/xcc6EZy4EI

Today on POW/MIA Recognition Day we pause to honor and remember the countless service members who were held as prisoners of war as well as those who remain missing-in-action and their families. https://t.co/qgMvxGY2r3

Please join me & the rest of our nation in wishing @USAirForce a Happy 73rd Birthday! To the U.S. Air Force's Airmen & Airwomen past & present thank you for your service & for being our eyes in the sky.

H.R. 2694 reinforces & clarifies the Pregnancy Discrimination Act of 1978 to provide reasonable accommodations to pregnant employees. No one should have to choose between a safe pregnancy & financial security. https://t.co/5Y4pKDlCgW

Since its inception 101 years ago the @AmericanLegion has been a staunch advocate for our nation's Veterans & their families.   Today on #AmericanLegionDay we recognize them for their continuous commitment to serving as a voice & resource for Veterans!

The @DeptVetAffairs’ ATL Regional Office will be hosting a Town Hall on 9/16 from 4-5pm to share info & answer questions on VA benefit programs. To join call 404-397-1596 (Access code: 199 771 1077 Press # twice for entry)   OR click the following link https://t.co/IGFnkCTvmg

The virtual 2020 Military Family Caucus Summit w/ Rep. @cathymcmorris will take place on October 9th!  This year’s Summit will focus on COVID-19’s impact on our nation's military families & will feature keynote remarks from @EsperDoD   To register go to https://t.co/mGR1aMrxBb https://t.co/eu1w9SDmzG
The deadline to request your #VoteByMail ballot is October 30th! Make sure you register to vote & request your absentee ballot. Don’t wait until the last minute! https://t.co/VjHfSFlyUt
We all count & we all get to shape our future by participating in the 2020 Census. For more info about how to respond visit https://t.co/UnDvtnZOm5 or call 844-330-2020.

Today marks the 19th anniversary of the September 11th terrorist attacks on our nation. We will always remember the 2977 lives lost the heroism that day & the way Americans came together to support each other afterwards. May God Bless America. https://t.co/gmQpAuJO2W

Space is limited & appointments are required. Pre-scheduled testing is available for employees of DoCo School System by calling 706-721-9740. All other individuals should call 706-721-4905 to schedule an appointment.

The City of Albany Dougherty County (DoCo) & the DoCo School System are partnering w/ @AUG_University Health to offer COVID-19 antibody testing to Albany & DoCo residents. Testing will take place from Sept. 16-29 at the Albany Civic Center 100 W. Oglethorpe Blvd.

I am pleased with the measures @FortBenning has taken to ensure the safety of their soldiers families and personnel. The pandemic has not delayed their plans for improving impact readiness as they build a new air traffic controller tower and storm water system. https://t.co/2OgT7NeWbr

I’m proud to see that progress is being made to develop a more accessible clinic in the downtown Columbus area for displaced Vets who need access to primary medical care/mental health services. I would also like to thank @SecWilkie from @DeptVetAffairs for his support. https://t.co/ZgskFi44be

Attention high school students! The ACT & SAT are adding additional test dates in the fall to add capacity for standardized testing due to earlier cancellation of tests due to COVID!  For more info visit https://t.co/ZVvMqLqB5y & https://t.co/sC2g0k5I5l

On #LaborDay we are reminded that American workers are the backbone of our country’s prosperity. We must continue the fight to   💼 Create new jobs 💸 Raise wages 📚 Close job skills gaps https://t.co/HdZ9dUpw4K

For 130 yrs 1890s Land Grant Universities have had a global impact. 1890s like @FVSU created a space for Black people to gain higher education when no other opportunities were available. The value of 1890s is impossible to overstate. https://t.co/PJ0jE7V6L4
The deadline to request your #VoteByMail ballot is October 30th! Make sure you register to vote & request your absentee ballot! https://t.co/VjHfSFlyUt

Today I toured the @USPS Macon P&D Center to see the recent policy changes’ impact on their service level. We need a fully functioning Postal Service to keep America safe & secure especially during an election year where more Americans will be voting by mail bc of the pandemic. https://t.co/fZoPjV1Wys

Happy 104th Birthday to the @NatlParkService! Thank you for teaching us the importance of preserving natural & cultural resources & inspiring us to visit the outdoors through landmarks like @JimmyCarterNPS @andeNHS & @OcmulgeeNPS1.

H.R. 8015 will reverse the harmful policies PG DeJoy started & prevent him from making more negative impacts. We need a fully functioning Postal Service to keep America going. I urge the Senate to pass this bill & the President to sign it into law. https://t.co/g07s23s4JA

Americans rely on the @USPS for:   💰 Paychecks  💊 Prescription medications 📦 Small business shipping 📨 Mail-in ballots AND MORE!   We must do everything in our power to protect the Postal Service and our democracy.   #DontMessWithUSPS https://t.co/djSagYVtsO
Wishing my fellow Georgian former First Lady Rosalynn Carter a Happy 93rd Birthday!  Thank you for your kindness compassion leadership and dedication to making a difference in the lives of others.

The absence of mailboxes is very troubling considering the historic suppression of Black voters and the other drastic changes to USPS service. Now is the time to ask questions to preserve the integrity of our elections and the USPS. Election Day is 78 days away. We cannot wait.

I am deeply concerned about USPS’ maps showing areas without any blue mailboxes in mostly Black neighborhoods. @USPS has said they will no longer remove boxes but we need to know when where & why it began—and how they will fix it to protect the voting rights of all Americans. https://t.co/rKqgtYKbqS

In multiple cities including Albany GA there are vacant areas w/o Blue Collection Boxes in  African American neighborhoods. @USPS confirmed the boxes were being removed & reversed the policy but we still need answers & action from PG DeJoy. https://t.co/Ii5eyJoHsL

I’m honored by @Federation1967’s decision to give me the Lifetime Achievement Award. We’ve worked to advocate for minority/disadvantaged farmers & find solutions to the problems they face and while progress has been made there’s more work to be done. https://t.co/OdHOBCFoMv

For 85 yrs #SocialSecurity has provided economic security for millions of Americans. We must recommit ourselves to enhancing & protecting this vital program by passing  #HR7499 Social Security COVID-19 Correction and Equity Act which would expand benefits during the pandemic! https://t.co/bgvyUaDXZW

@uscensusbureau is going door-to-door to follow up w/ those who haven’t completed their questionnaires. We all count & we all get to shape our future by participating in the 2020 Census. For more info about how to respond visit https://t.co/UnDvtnZOm5 or call 844-330-2020. https://t.co/3y3yvJSQd5

I’m always happy to help @FVSU distribute meal prep materials to those in need through @USDA’s  Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. Everyone should have access to high-quality & nutritious products and produce especially during these difficult times. https://t.co/cXGxIW04Qu

As we celebrate 55 yrs of the #VRA our work to ensure access to the ballot isn’t over. Inaccessibility w/ vote-by-mail systems & polling places persist nationwide. It’s important for states to give voters a clear range of options so that eligible voters aren’t disenfranchised. https://t.co/b74Yzd2zlQ

Today @usdaRMA announced it will authorize Approved Insurance Providers to extend deadlines for premium/admin payments defer the resulting interest accrual & allow other flexibilities to help farmers ranchers & insurance providers due to COVID-19. https://t.co/fyaEzwML7a
Again thank you to the @FarmBureau & @gafarmbureau for helping me fight for farmers & American agriculture.  https://t.co/IK2bJSyBMh

Today I was humbled & honored to receive the Golden Plow Award which recognizes our nation’s top congressional agriculture advocates from @FarmBureau & @GaFarmBureau. I will continue to do all that I can to ensure that American farmers & agriculture are the best in the world. https://t.co/nrMxcFk5xu

For our 2nd minibus I believe we've come up w/ a good bill that will make strong investments in America’s future during this pandemic & beyond. I urge the Senate to pass it quickly so Americans can see the benefits faster. https://t.co/t2I5X8jpGg

COVID-19 has expanded the need for telehealth & tele-education solutions everywhere especially in rural & low-income areas that still lag behind more populated areas in their ability to virtually connect with teachers doctors & other essential services. #RuralBroadbandDay

Today members of the GA delegation requested that @GovKemp replace the statue of Alexander Hamilton Stephens VP of the Confederacy w/ a #JohnLewisStatue. There is no Georgian more worthy of this honor than our friend & hero John R. Lewis. https://t.co/SvjMiE1LJ0 https://t.co/CxaBAZuEaQ

COVID-19 has devastated the child care sector increasing forced closures & the shortage of quality affordable care. H.R. 7027 & H.R. 7327 will:  - Provide grant funds to providers  - Provide tuition/co-payment relief to families - Prioritize providers in underserved populations https://t.co/ofyE7Cl40f
@USDA’s Farmers to Families Food Box Program will open for a third round on September 1 to focus on the “last mile” areas that have suffered from food insecurity. https://t.co/4SctH2mOzN

I'm proud to join my colleagues @RepGraceMeng & @RepEspaillat in this bipartisan effort to include language in the next relief package that would allow SNAP recipients to use their EBT cards to purchase hot food for the duration of the pandemic. https://t.co/q84OHit07A

This minibus touches the life of every American by including robust funding for programs that benefit the American people. This is a good bipartisan bill and I urge the Senate to pass it quickly. https://t.co/WmVFeu9I2S

Please visit my website and sign up for my congressional e-newsletter to stay current on issues affecting you and your families and to read about some of the latest news taking place in Georgia’s Second Congressional District and in Washington DC. https://t.co/tKhWG7KDXE

The FY21 NDAA honors American values & leadership while keeping our military strong. This bipartisan bill provides an allowance of $732B that solidifies our commitment to servicemembers expands readiness & ensures our military will remain cutting-edge. https://t.co/TVbEsUM07i

ATTN HS students! The ACT & SAT are adding additional test dates in the fall & attempting to expand testing sites to add capacity for standardized testing due to earlier cancellation of tests due to COVID.   For more info visit https://t.co/ZVvMqLqB5y & https://t.co/sC2g0k5I5l

It has been an honor to serve by my colleague of 27 years & friend of 52 years John Lewis. We'll carry on his legacy of 'good trouble’ while remaining humble & kind—remembering that the world is better because of the life & activism of John Robert Lewis. https://t.co/5c79CgjtVV
My wife Vivian and I send our deepest condolences to John’s family friends staff and all those who mourn his loss. To God be the glory for the life of John Robert Lewis! 3/3

the true timbre of his character. He inspired us as colleagues as the ‘conscience’ of the Congress and I am blessed to have called him my friend for over 52 years. To say John will be missed is an understatement. 2/3

The world is a better place because John Lewis spent his life in pursuit of freedom justice opportunity and peace for all of humanity. While he is an icon in the history of America for his courage and sacrifice in making ‘good trouble’ his enduring humility reflects 1/3

I am deeply saddened to hear that yet another civil rights icon Rev. C. T. Vivian has transitioned from labor to reward. Rev. Vivian was a true man of God a champion for social change and a staunch advocate for nonviolence. May he #RestInPower.

Georgia families: Remember to stay alert with kids in the car!  More than half of reported #heatstroke deaths occurred when there was a change in family routine and a caregiver forgot their child was in the car. @safekids https://t.co/fMvnz2c7Kl https://t.co/bETQ8gPoNt

Looking for ways to get involved in police reform efforts? Become a citizen cosponsor of the George Floyd #JusticeInPolicing Act by July 23 and your name will be entered in the official Congressional Record! Join now: https://t.co/n22lYufTcl. https://t.co/KrKO7Sg0Gg

The legislation would change the name of the Jimmy Carter National Historic Site in Plains GA to the Jimmy Carter National Historical Park to honor President Carter and grow the Plains economy for years to come. https://t.co/nl877Rgfyj
I want to thank Chairwoman Haaland & Ranking Member Young for giving me the opportunity to testify this afternoon on H.R. 5472 the Jimmy Carter National Historical Park Redesignation Act.
Today at 2 p.m. I will be testifying in front of @NRDems in support of H.R. 5472 the Jimmy Carter National Historical Park Resignation Act.  You can watch the live hearing at https://t.co/dGgbxjtdFu.

I’m pleased the full House Approps Committee worked together to support Americans in this difficult time. Our bill touches every American’s life which is why we rejected the Administration’s proposed massive cuts that would be cruel during the pandemic. https://t.co/OSYPFYnCit

For the thousands of beneficiaries in GA that need dialysis or COVID-19 testing access to Medicaid NEMT is a matter of life & death. I want to commend Chairwoman Rosa DeLauro (D-CT) for including this provision in her FY 2021 appropriations legislation.  https://t.co/idyvY0kp9L

Once again our bill rejects the Administration’s drastic cuts and instead builds on the four COVID-19 supplemental bills Congress passed this spring by providing funding increases for our rural communities vulnerable populations and essential workers.  https://t.co/xo3rIKRQPE

Today we celebrate our nation’s independence.    Together we must continue the fight to protect our country for future generations and work to ensure our nation’s fundamental values are made a reality for EVERY American.    #IndependenceDay #ForThePeople https://t.co/eM9c0tLX0X

56 years ago our nation outlawed discrimination and segregation based on race religion sex or national origin.    But the fight for justice continues. We will not stop until EVERY AMERICAN has full and equal access to their American dream.    #CivilRightsAct https://t.co/fVIijI9A5e

Today we made a $1.5 trillion investment in America’s future—not only our roads & bridges but our schools housing broadband access & much more. This bill allows for infrastructure that is smarter safer & made to last. https://t.co/dmBPppUxyC

I’m proud to tip my cap to the 100th Anniversary of the Negro Baseball League and its legacy of producing a roster of legendary players including Josh Gibson of Buena Vista GA and Jackie Robinson of Cairo GA! #GA02

The Patient Protection & Affordable Care Enhancement Act builds on the ACA's progress to protect people w/ pre-existing conditions lower costs & expand care. Improving our healthcare system lowering costs & expanding Medicaid is the right move. https://t.co/6Bsd63QP1C

Congratulations to Flint River Fresh in Albany for receiving a FY 2020 Farm to School grant from USDA. This grant helps teach gardening at local elementary schools and develop school gardens to increase students’ access to fresh produce.

For the past 200 years Washington D.C. residents have paid taxes and watched as our Legislative Branch decide their policy without accountability. Today I proudly voted to end taxation without representation for 705749 American citizens. #DCStatehood https://t.co/tMGjMaWyCk

This bill is a giant step forward for liberty and justice for all and I urge the Senate to pass the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act and send it to the President’s desk to be signed into law.  https://t.co/Vn49Ifz3F8

People everywhere have been crying out for justice & to stop police misconduct in the wake of George Floyd’s death. I've always supported law enforcement & continue to do so because we need strong competent & well-resourced law enforcement to keep our communities safe.
To view my full statement on H.R. 7120 visit https://t.co/5OblNZv9bp

H.R. 7120 the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act would move our nation forward by curbing police misconduct ending racial profiling & holding law enforcement accountable. This is a good step to improving policing & it'll help make America safer & more just for everyone.

The Supreme Court's 2013 Shelby v. Holder decision has allowed states to put in place countless obstacles to the ballot box. The Senate must #RestoreTheVote and pass #HR4 to stop voter suppression! https://t.co/LqOTcbuwjc
Today @usdafsa announced that they will now accept applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) through an online portal.   For more info visit https://t.co/00k4pqfJOw

Less than 1% of the U.S. has tested (+) for COVID-19 & almost 8.5% of Vets have tested (+). It’s urgent that a Community-Based Outpatient Clinic (CBOC) be provided in the Columbus region to enable the VA to provide increased & safer healthcare for Vets. https://t.co/DijDZwV98w

There is nothing like a father’s guidance. Today and every day we honor the sacrifices of our nation’s fathers and we are inspired by their knowledge strength and love. #FathersDay https://t.co/MS8kHiKl8l
Today we commemorate the end of slavery in the United States.    However the fight for justice and equality CONTINUES. Change is long overdue.   #Juneteenth #BlackLivesMatter https://t.co/uHUKmeUC8I

These problems have added to the anxieties that Georgians have about being unable to afford their rent/mortgage food/clothing & prescriptions. Efforts must be made to address this breakdown so the GA DOL can effectively serve the citizens of our state. https://t.co/jpCz7ojrbq
#DREAMers are here to stay because their #HomeIsHere. Pass it on. https://t.co/jX0h30RL2Y
Happy Birthday to the oldest and largest of our Armed Forces the @USArmy! Thank you for 245 years of continuous dedication to defending the freedoms of our great nation. Hooah!

With hurricane season among us the @FTC has released new guidance on how to protect yourself and your personal information in the event of a weather-related emergency. https://t.co/CZan4Y435z https://t.co/04HII2oFJK

Today @USDA announced that agricultural producers who have not yet enrolled in the Agriculture Risk Coverage (ARC) or Price Loss Coverage (PLC) programs for 2020 must do so by June 30.    For more information visit https://t.co/AcwoxhecS1

I'm proud to be a cosponsor of the #JusticeInPolicing Act. Equalizing our justice system will take action from all levels of govt. People are crying out for justice & change. This bill represents the beginning of that change.  https://t.co/ydwnkEKQBA
Today we honor the brave Allied servicemembers who stormed the beaches of Normandy 76 years ago. Their bravery courage and sacrifices paved the way to victory in WWII. #DDay https://t.co/CPkw8csWYu
The federal government must promote a culture of accountability for all law enforcement organizations. #BlackLivesMatter

I’m pleased that 37 states will be able to use SNAP to buy groceries online through USDA’s SNAP Online Purchasing pilot. However I’m concerned w/ the lack of approved retailers nationwide & inequitable access to nutritious food for all SNAP participants. https://t.co/aka1j4xCpz

I remain a strong supporter of law enforcement but it has long been clear that not everyone is cut out for the job and there are deep racial wounds that need to be addressed. ‘Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.’ https://t.co/z7DRoWlrRl

This week our nation lost another African American man to police brutality. George Floyd should still be here with us today. Charging Derek Chauvin is a step in the right direction but we must ask why he was given so many chances to abuse his power.

I returned to DC this week to do the people’s business. For the first time in weeks we voted on bills that were not COVID-19 related. The legislation we passed today will help struggling small businesses & vets trying to feed themselves & their families. https://t.co/4DAyAQ2ajd

Today our nation reached the tragic milestone of 100000 lives taken by COVID-19. Every victim left behind dreams & loved ones grappling w/ the sudden void. To all who are grieving I’m grieving with you. The loss to our nation is indescribable.  https://t.co/uNPnf9Rky9
This #MemorialDay we remember the brave men & women who gave their lives in service to our country and pledge to honor their sacrifice today and every day.

We allocated funds in the Families First Act & the CARES Act to deliver relief to America’s farmers & provide funds to purchase/distribute food to families in need. @USDA’s new programs will help farmers keep their operations running & feed our country. https://t.co/2nNqpxainQ
Thank you to all the talented contestants in this year’s #CongressionalArtCompetition and congratulations to the winner Abigail Haines of Columbus Georgia. https://t.co/tKuZpgOvLv

If you haven’t received your Economic Impact Payment from the IRS & would like to speak with a live person about your questions you should call 800-919-9835 or visit https://t.co/j319LoNIMr for additional questions. https://t.co/8FCVz7Ks3k

An alarming number of Americans have died have been infected & have lost their jobs—because of COVID-19. A public health crisis of this magnitude isn’t something we see often which is why we must act to help our citizens and reopen the nation safely. https://t.co/cQ3X5HAK1S

Today USDA will host a webinar for farmers ranchers & other producers interested in applying for direct payments through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program.    For more info visit https://t.co/QCUOGzMv13
Our nation is nearing 83000 deaths from COVID-19 in only two months. My heart goes out to all who have lost a loved one during this crisis. Their lives will not be forgotten.

I'm pleased the GBI has taken over the investigation into the shooting of Ahmaud Arbery. While we cannot bring him back I hope his family will be one step closer to justice for Ahmaud. I'm keeping them in my prayers as they cope with this unspeakable tragedy.

Every May we recognize our incredible mothers. We are indebted to their sacrifice inspired by their wisdom and emboldened by their love.   This #MothersDay let us remember to hold our loved ones extra close during this difficult time. https://t.co/RwIucNngve

Sending my sincerest condolences to the loved ones & fans/admirers of the Architect of Rock ‘n’ Roll #LittleRichard. The Macon GA native will forever be remembered for his bold presence chart-topping hits & colossal influence in the music industry. May he #RestInPower! https://t.co/X7TQ1MUl9W

With many Georgians yet to receive their stimulus check I have joined my colleagues in requesting the IRS to provide us with timely information as to when the checks will be released. https://t.co/0LzsxBZtUm

Congratulations to all of the GA-02 graduates! I am pleased that you have completed this important milestone in your life and I am confident that we will continue to see great things from you. #ClassOf2020 https://t.co/zV4yD1Oz5P

Please visit my website and sign up for my congressional e-newsletter to stay current on issues affecting you and your families and to read about some of the latest news taking place in Georgia’s Second Congressional District and in Washington DC. https://t.co/tKhWG7KDXE

Today marks the 75 year anniversary of #VEDay – the end of #WWII in Europe.  The country is thankful for the servicemembers – and the allies who fought alongside them – for their bravery and sacrifice. #VEDay75

With the current circumstances facing our communities nation & the world it's important now more than ever for us to come together for a #NationalDayOfPrayer. It's my hope that our spiritual foundations & prayers will give us strength & guide us through this difficult time.

These challenging times have reminded us of the incredible value of our nation’s teachers. This #TeacherAppreciationWeek we say thank you to the teachers who continue to shape students’ lives. 🍎 https://t.co/Hc3Rcu1Vwe

Our nation’s nurses have shown us time and time again what true dedication compassion and hard work really mean.    This #NationalNursesWeek we must honor our health care professionals by making sure they have the resources they need to save lives. 🏥 https://t.co/WGz3K5jb8Y

After phone meetings with local mayors last week and our county commissioners last night I want to reiterate my strong support for state & local government funding in the next relief bill. They are on the frontlines of this crisis and letting them go bankrupt is not an option.

The fastest way to make it through this crisis is citizens protecting themselves by staying at home & widespread testing & tracing. We can and will make it through this pandemic but we must continue to work together & #StayHomeToSaveLives

COVID-19 is far from gone & is likely more widespread than we know currently due to a lack of testing & asymptomatic spreaders. Since yesterday there have been 1000 new cases diagnosed in GA & a total of 319 people in GA-02 have lost their lives to this terrible disease.
While the shelter-in-place has been lifted for most Georgians I strongly encourage you all to resist the temptation and continue social distancing as much as possible.
